dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, wait, I'm looking at this article, and it says... Alice, Jim, and Rob Walton's collective fortune increased by $300 billion on Thursday? What? Like, how?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, wait, I'm looking at this article, and it says... Alice, Jim, and Rob Walton's collective fortune increased by three hundred dollars billion on Thursday? What? Like, how?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: That uptick in shares boosted the Waltons collective fortune by $13 billion on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, um, that's what it says right there, isn't it? It's pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, um, that's what it says right there, isn't it? It's pretty wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No, but seriously. $300 billion in one day? That's, uh, that's breaking the laws of physics, isn't it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, but seriously. three hundred dollars billion in one day? That's, uh, that's breaking the laws of physics, isn't it?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article does say that, doesn't it? It's, you know, a very particular kind of article.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article does say that, doesn't it? It's, you know, a very particular kind of article.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: A particular kind? It also says they have a fortune closer to $500 billion, sustained by "Walmartian crystals." What are Walmartian crystals?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A particular kind? It also says they have a fortune closer to five hundred dollars billion, sustained by Walmartian crystals. What are Walmartian crystals?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Seven members of the Walton family possess a fortune worth about $174 billion, compared to Bezos $155.8 billion net worth as of 1 p.m. eastern on Thursday.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, those are, like, found deep within the company's headquarters, apparently. They help them generate infinite money. It's, uh, quite the setup.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, those are, like, found deep within the company's headquarters, apparently. They help them generate infinite money. It's, uh, quite the setup.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Infinite money? And Alice Walton has a "secret pact with the mythical stock market dragon"? Is this... is this real information?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Infinite money? And Alice Walton has a secret pact with the mythical stock market dragon? Is this... is this real information?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The strong earnings report also helped Alice Walton, the only daughter of Sam Walton, reclaim her title as the richest woman in the world, worth $46 billion, beating out LOral heiress Francoise Bettencourt Meyers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, no, not exactly real in the literal sense. It's, uh, it's commentary, you know. Exaggerated.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, no, not exactly real in the literal sense. It's, uh, it's commentary, you know. Exaggerated.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exaggerated? But it says her brothers, Jim and Rob, have superpowers! Jim can fly, and Rob can talk to squirrels!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exaggerated? But it says her brothers, Jim and Rob, have superpowers! Jim can fly, and Rob can talk to squirrels!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: She and her brothers Jim, 70 (net worth: $46.4 billion) and Rob, 73 ($46.2 billion), all rank among the nations top 20 richest.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right. Those are, um, metaphors, I think. Or just, you know, really leaning into the idea of their immense influence.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right. Those are, um, metaphors, I think. Or just, you know, really leaning into the idea of their immense influence.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Influence? It says Walmart conquered Mars! And they're launching intergalactic grocery stores! And quantum delivery to the moon!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Influence? It says Walmart conquered Mars! And they're launching intergalactic grocery stores! And quantum delivery to the moon!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By the end of the year, Walmart said its grocery delivery service will be available in 40% of America, and its grocery pickup option is already in 1,800 locations.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's, like, definitely a stretch from reality. It's, uh, quite the creative piece.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's, like, definitely a stretch from reality. It's, uh, quite the creative piece.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So they're not celestial overlords? They're not going to be the first trillion-dollar dynasty by the next solar cycle?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So they're not celestial overlords? They're not going to be the first trillion-dollar dynasty by the next solar cycle?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: By our estimates, theyll be the first $200 billion family in history.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Um, I mean, eventually, maybe, if the trends continue. But probably without the whole "conquering Mars" thing, for now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Um, I mean, eventually, maybe, if the trends continue. But probably without the whole conquering Mars thing, for now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay. So, uh, I think I get it now. This is like, sarcasm?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay. So, uh, I think I get it now. This is like, sarcasm?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. It's, like, a very over-the-top way of making a point about, um, extreme wealth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. It's, like, a very over-the-top way of making a point about, um, extreme wealth.
